intro: Hieracium torrembecense, commonly known as the Torrembessa hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are generally hairy and arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
